    PointInPolygonAngle(Point2D, Point2DList)

    • ref: http://ozviz.wasp.uwa.edu.au/~pbourke/geometry/insidepoly/ - Solution 2
    • Compute the sum of the angles made between the test point and each pair of points making up the polygon.
    • If this sum is 2pi then the point is an interior point, if 0 then the point is an exterior point.
    Declaration
    public bool PointInPolygonAngle(Point2D point, Point2DList polygon)
    Parameters
    Type Name Description
    Point2D point
    Point2DList polygon
    Returns
    Type Description
    Boolean
    | Improve this Doc View Source

    VectorAngle(Point2D, Point2D)

    Return the angle between two vectors on a plane The angle is from vector 1 to vector 2, positive anticlockwise The result is between -pi -> pi

    Declaration
    public double VectorAngle(Point2D p1, Point2D p2)
